headline.main: Motherlode Must-Read: 'The Baby Chase: How Surrogacy Is Transforming the American Family'

docs.abstract: Leslie Morgan Steiner’s book is a captivating exploration of the experience and ethics of surrogacy, and one of my favorite books about family from 2013.
docs.snippet: Leslie Morgan Steiner’s book is a captivating exploration of the experience and ethics of surrogacy, and one of my favorite books about family from 2013.

headline.main: Do TV Shows Like ‘16 and Pregnant' Promote or Discourage Teenage Pregnancy?

docs.abstract: Do you think these shows glamorize teenage pregnancy? Or do they present a cautionary tale?
docs.snippet: Do you think these shows glamorize teenage pregnancy? Or do they present a cautionary tale?

byline.original: By MICHAEL GONCHAR and KATHERINE SCHULTEN

docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court should uphold sensible buffer zones at health clinics.
docs.abstract: Editorial urges Supreme Court to uphold 2007 Massachusetts law preventing protesters from coming within 35 feet of abortion clinics; holds law falls within state's power to protect public safety, and that its effect on free speech is both neutral and incidental.
docs.snippet: The Supreme Court should uphold sensible buffer zones at health clinics.

docs.lead_paragraph: The court declined to hear an appeal from Arizona officials seeking to reinstate a state law barring most abortions after 20 weeks of gestation.

headline.main: Supreme Court Won’t Hear Arizona Appeal on Abortion Ban
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Won’t Hear Arizona Appeal on Abortion Ban

docs.abstract: Supreme Court declines to hear appeal from Arizona officials seeking to revive a state law barring most abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy.
docs.snippet: The court declined to hear an appeal from Arizona officials seeking to reinstate a state law barring most abortions after 20 weeks of gestation.

byline.contributor: Adam Liptak reported from Washington, and Fernanda Santos from Phoenix. Erik Eckholm contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By ADAM LIPTAK and FERNANDA SANTOS

headline.main: Would a Pregnancy Through a Donor Egg Feel Like 'Mine'?

docs.abstract: My chances of pregnancy would be better with a donor egg. But would the baby really be mine? And would he or she have to convert?
docs.snippet: My chances of pregnancy would be better with a donor egg. But would the baby really be mine? And would he or she have to convert?

docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court on Monday declined to hear Arizona's appeal of a lower-court ruling that declared unconstitutional a state law banning abortions beginning at 20 weeks of fetal gestation, meaning the restrictive measure is struck down.

headline.main: Supreme Court Will Not Hear Arizona Abortion Law Appeal
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Will Not Hear Arizona Abortion Law Appeal

docs.snippet: The Supreme Court on Monday declined to hear Arizona's appeal of a lower-court ruling that declared unconstitutional a state law banning abortions beginning at 20 weeks of fetal gestation, meaning the restrictive measure is struck down.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nine women in Sweden have successfully received transplanted wombs donated from relatives in an experimental procedure that has raised some ethical concerns. The women will soon try to become pregnant with their new wombs, the doctor in charge of the pioneering project has revealed.

headline.main: Swedish Doctors Transplant Wombs Into 9 Women
headline.print_headline: Swedish Doctors Transplant Wombs Into 9 Women

docs.lead_paragraph: A study finds that MTV’s “16 and Pregnant,” a reality show depicting very young parents, may have contributed to a drop in teenage pregnancy.

headline.main: MTV’s ‘16 and Pregnant,’ Derided by Some, May Resonate as a Cautionary Tale
headline.print_headline: MTV’s ‘16 and Pregnant,’ Derided by Some, May Resonate as a Cautionary Tale

docs.abstract: National Bureau of Economic Research study finds that MTV’s 16 and Pregnant, reality show depicting very young parents, and its spinoffs may have contributed to a drop in teenage pregnancy; says they may have prevented more than 20,000 births to teenage mothers in 2010.
docs.snippet: A study finds that MTV’s “16 and Pregnant,” a reality show depicting very young parents, may have contributed to a drop in teenage pregnancy.

docs.lead_paragraph: Transgender men and women have the right to be parents, too.

headline.main: The Next Frontier in Fertility Treatment
headline.print_headline: The Next Frontier in Fertility Treatment

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author Sarah Elizabeth Richards calls attention to discrimination many transgender men and women face from health providers, particularly when trying to have children; maintains gender identity has nothing to do with the desire to have children, and transgender men and women have the right to be parents.
docs.snippet: Transgender men and women have the right to be parents, too.
